paragraph_US: A WBC count (Leukocyte count, White blood cell count ) is a blood test to measure the number of white blood cells (WBCs).
paragraph_SI: A WBC count (Leukocyte count, White blood cell count ) is a blood test to measure the number of white blood cells (WBCs).

paragraph_US: White blood cells help fight infections. They are also called leukocytes. There are five major types of white blood cells: Basophils, eosinophils, lymphocytes (T cells and B cells), monocytes and neutrophils.
paragraph_SI: White blood cells help fight infections. They are also called leukocytes. There are five major types of white blood cells: Basophils, eosinophils, lymphocytes (T cells and B cells), monocytes and neutrophils.

paragraph_US: A low number of WBCs is called leukopenia. It may be due to:  Bone marrow failure (for example, due to infection, tumor, or abnormal scarring), collagen-vascular diseases (such as lupus erythematosus), disease of the liver or spleen or radiation.
paragraph_SI: A low number of WBCs is called leukopenia. It may be due to:  Bone marrow failure (for example, due to infection, tumor, or abnormal scarring), collagen-vascular diseases (such as lupus erythematosus), disease of the liver or spleen or radiation.
